title: Notes on tiny launches
content:
Tiny launches are about momentum, not grandeur. I ship a page, a button, or a single integration and then tell ten people who might care. Feedback is immediate and specific because the scope is obvious.

The discipline is to stop decorating. No extra animations, no dead-end settings, no unneeded copy. Just the minimum path to learn whether the idea resonates.

After a few cycles, the surface area grows naturally, but only in response to actual use. That keeps the project lean and the hosting simple.
